titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Zebulon Alexander Terry Scrapbook
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: This scrapbook primarily documents Terry's life as a student at Stanford and includes photographs, clippings, athletic event programs and tickets, theatrical programs, invitations, his class cards, dance cards, and other memorabilia. Subjects include athletics (football, baseball, track, and crew), the Delta Tau Delta fraternity, and student amusements such as the Frosh-Soph Tie-Up, Peerades, and the Plug Ugly. There are also clippings and photographs pertaining to Terry's professional athletic career and memorabilia from his tour in the armed services during World War I.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Zebulon Alexander Terry Scrapbook (SC0503). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Zebulon Alexander Terry graduated from Stanford University in 1914 with an A.B. in economics. He was shortstop on the Stanford baseball team, serving as captain of the team in 1913 and 1914. After graduation, he played professional baseball with the Chicago White Sox, the Pittsburgh Pirates, and the Chicago Cubs.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook primarily documents Terry's life as a student at Stanford and includes photographs, clippings, athletic event programs and tickets, theatrical programs, invitations, his class cards, dance cards, and other memorabilia. Subjects include athletics (football, baseball, track, and crew), the Delta Tau Delta fraternity, and student amusements such as the Frosh-Soph Tie-Up, Peerades, and the Plug Ugly. There are also clippings and photographs pertaining to Terry's professional athletic career and memorabilia from his tour in the armed services during World War I.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook pages pertaining to Stanford athletics, Delta Tau Delta fraternity, and student social life; also includes two photographs of Terry during professional ballgames
Scrapbook pages pertaining to student social life, Terry's professional baseball career, and his World War I military service
Correspondence: letter from David Starr Jordan, 1913; telegram offering baseball position, 1912
Photographs of Terry and other pro players, 1932-33 and undated
Track and field meet (Stanford and California), program, 1912
